list.text:
Birch Wood Wreath
Hot-glue 3" birch wood coasters ($16 for 20; rachaelsscraps.etsy.com) side by side to form a wreath shape. Add a mix of 3" and ¾" slices ($6 for 25; factorydirectcraft.com) atop each joint. Finish with ribbon for a pop of color.

Natural Frost
Use hot-glue to adhere acorns, sticks, pinecones, and walnuts to a 16" grapevine wreath. Apply a light coat of white spray-paint to create a frosted finish.

Snowman Wreath
A winter-inspired wreath will give your front door a welcoming, festive touch this holiday season. Plus, your kids will love it!

Rudolph Wreath
Craft a wreath that will put a smile on your face every time you enter your home. It's embellished with glitter and Christmas spirit.

Snowball Wreath
For this piece of winter front door decor you'll need wreath-shaped styrofoam, styrofoam balls, fake snow, decoupage medium, a brush, ribbon, and a glue gun.

Ribbon Candy Wreath
Made from wire and 2" striped ribbon, this is a simple way to make your house look merry—it's easy on the eyes and easy to make.

Modern Wire and Ornament Wreath
This fun and modern piece will draw your guests in to celebrate. It's a clever way to incorporate ornaments into a classic wreath design.

Wrapped Flannel Holiday Wreath
A great transition piece between seasons, flannel fabric provides an ode to fall while the faux trimmings add a wintery touch.

Weathered Glam Berry Wreath
Adorned with ribbon and berry stems, this beauty is a no-hassle craft with a finish that will leave you feeling merry and bright.

Gift Box Christmas Wreath
We just love this cute and creative design made with mini foil gift boxes and topped with a large bow.
